head.title: AT&T LATIN UNIT POSTPONES SHARE SALE

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance
Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Technology, Telecommunications and Internet

hedline.hl1: AT&T LATIN UNIT POSTPONES SHARE SALE

abstract.p: AT&T Latin America Corp, citing low stock prices, postpones planned issuance of 35 million common shares just weeks after company merged with FirstCom Corp, broadband communications group that operates in Chile, Peru and Colombia; company will instead rely on $200 million finance package from parent company, AT&T Corp, and long-term financing from vendors like Lucent Technologies and Nortel Networks to finance its expansion (S)

block.p: Citing low stock prices, the AT&T Latin America Corporation postponed a planned issuance of 35 million common shares just weeks after the company merged with the FirstCom Corporation, a broadband communications group that operates in Chile, Peru and Colombia. The company will instead rely on a $200 million finance package from its parent company, the AT&T Corporation, and long-term financing from vendors like Lucent Technologies and Nortel Networks to finance its expansion.

Citing low stock prices, the AT&T Latin America Corporation postponed a planned issuance of 35 million common shares just weeks after the company merged with the FirstCom Corporation, a broadband communications group that operates in Chile, Peru and Colombia. The company will instead rely on a $200 million finance package from its parent company, the AT&T Corporation, and long-term financing from vendors like Lucent Technologies and Nortel Networks to finance its expansion.
